definition: at first/suddenly/abruptly/to spread/(of hair) to stand on end/bristling

sentences.english: Bursts of mental clarity can be sudden and unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 靈光乍現可能會是突然發生的並且難以預測的。

sentences.english: In the moment of love, the nature of emptiness dawns nakedly…
sentences.chinese: 當愛的霎那，空靈乍現赤裸的曙光。

sentences.english: 'We can finally see a light at the end of the tunnel.'
sentences.chinese: 我們終於可以看到隧道盡頭曙光乍現。

sentences.english: A light bulb just went on. I'd suddenly remembered something the teacher said in class.
sentences.chinese: 我靈光乍現，突然想起老師在課堂上說過的一個東西。

sentences.english: Taviano said the idea to travel to zoos just kind of popped in her head.
sentences.chinese: 塔維安諾說，造訪動物園的構想就這樣乍現腦海。

sentences.english: A day is an experiment; a year is a development.
sentences.chinese: 一日僅是靈光乍現，一年方成一脈哲理。

sentences.english: I just want to be there when the morning light explodes on your face it radiates.
sentences.chinese: 在晨光乍現從妳臉龐散發出來，我只想一直待在那。

sentences.english: If clarity strikes, jot down every idea that crosses your mind.
sentences.chinese: 如果突然靈光乍現，記下腦海中閃現的每個想法。

definition: nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
variant of 餘暉|余晖[yu2 hui1]
